item.title: FINAL ALERT, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service has located the 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nerang around 4.30pm yesterday. The little girl was located safe and well on Spall Street by a member of the public who was tasked to search… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service has located the 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nerang around 4.30pm yesterday.

The little girl was located safe and well on Spall Street by a member of the public who was tasked to search the area. The girl was found at the end of the street in tall grass.

Police would like to thank the SES, media, local businesses and the hundreds of people who volunteered their services to assist with the search.

item.title: MEDIA ALERT: Amber Alert, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Amber Alert triggered for missing a five-year-old girl has been cancelled. Police will provide an update to media at the Foward Command Post at the 7 Eleven at Nielsens Road within the next ten minutes. It will be livestreamed at… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Amber Alert triggered for missing a five-year-old girl has been cancelled.

Police will provide an update to media at the Foward Command Post at the 7 Eleven at Nielsens Road within the next ten minutes.

It will be livestreamed at www.livestream.com/queenslandpolice

item.title: LOCATED – UPDATE 6: Amber Alert, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: This girl has been located safe and well. Police are appealing for dash cam footage as they continue the search for a five-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road at Nerang around 4.30pm yesterday. Motorists with dash cam footage… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
This girl has been located safe and well.

Police are appealing for dash cam footage as they continue the search for a five-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road at Nerang around 4.30pm yesterday.

Motorists with dash cam footage, who may have been driving in the vicinity of Nielsens Road anytime from 4pm yesterday, are asked to review their vision to see if it contains any information which may assist police with their investigations.

She is described as Caucasian in appearance, around 115 centimetres tall with blonde, shoulder-length hair.

She was last seen wearing a pink t-shirt with a lady bird emblem on the front, dark blue denim shorts and no shoes.

If anyone does locate vision police ask that the footage be downloaded to a USB and delivered to the nearest police station or the Command Post at the 7 Eleven on Nielsens Road.

At the current time police have enough volunteers to conduct the search but the public can assist by rechecking backyards and surrounding areas.

Call 131 564 if you see her or to provide any other information you think police should know.

Call Triple Zero (000) to provide life threatening information about this incident.

item.title: LOCATED – Update 5: Amber Alert, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: This girl has now been located safe and well. The Queensland Police Service is continuing to seek urgent public assistance to help locate five-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road at Nerang around 4.30pm yesterday. Police are being joined… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
This girl has now been located safe and well.

The Queensland Police Service is continuing to seek urgent public assistance to help locate five-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road at Nerang around 4.30pm yesterday.

Police are being joined by State Emergency Service volunteers and members of the public to search for her around the Nerang and Carrara areas.

She is described as Caucasian in appearance, around 115 centimetres tall with blonde, shoulder-length hair.

She was last seen wearing a pink t-shirt with a lady bird emblem on the front, dark blue denim shorts and no shoes.

Residents living in the area between Alexander Drive, Hinkler Drive, Explorer Way and surrounds are asked to check their yards, sheds, pools and other hiding spots for the girl.

People who have already checked their homes and yards are asked to check again – particularly any areas where a child may curl up, have a sleep or hide.

People searching for her are encouraged to call out her name.

If you locate her, do not approach her as she suffers from a medical condition and may not react as expected.

Call 131 564 if you see her or to provide any other information you think police should know.

Call Triple Zero (000) to provide life threatening information about this incident.

If members of the public wish to join the search, they should attend the 7 Eleven on Nielsens Road so that their efforts can be properly coordinated.

Approximately 160 police and SES personnel are currently involved in the search including members of the Gold Coast Rapid Action and Patrol Group, plain clothes officers, the Mounted Unit, Water Police as well as officers from Brisbane.

The New South Wales Police Force has offered the QPS assistance if required, but this generous offer has not yet been taken up.

item.title: LOCATED – UPDATE 4: Amber alert, Missing child, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: This girl has now been located safe and well. The Queensland Police Service continues to seek urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang at 4.30pm yesterday. Police have revoked an… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
This girl has now been located safe and well.

The Queensland Police Service continues to seek urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang at 4.30pm yesterday.

Police have revoked an emergent situation declared under the Public Safety Preservation Act (PSPA) to assist police and SES personnel search for the missing girl.

The exclusion zone was declared at 12.50am and was bounded by Gilston Road, Hinde Road, Latimers Crossing Road, Nerang-Murwillumbah Road, Beaudesert-Nerang Road, Ferry Connection Road, Nerang-Broadbeach Road, Gooding Drive, Mudgeeraba Road, Worongary-Advancetown-Mudgeeraba Road.

Due to public cooperation the PSPA has since been revoked.

Approximately 160 Police and State Emergency Service personnel are currently involved in the search, including members of Gold Coast Rapid Action Patrol, plain clothes officers and Pol-Air.

Police continue to encourage people in the surrounding areas to remain vigilant and search their own property rather than attend the search location.

item.title: LOCATED – UPDATE 2: Amber alert, Missing child, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: This girl has now been located safe and well. The Queensland Police Service continues to seek urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang at 4.30pm yesterday. An exclusion zone has… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
This girl has now been located safe and well.

The Queensland Police Service continues to seek urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang at 4.30pm yesterday.

An exclusion zone has been declared under the Public Safety Preservation Act (PSPA) to assist police and SES personnel search for the missing girl.

The exclusion zone was declared at 12:50 and is bounded by Gilston Road, Hinde Road, Latimers Crossing Road, Nerang-Murwillumbah Road, Beaudesert-Nerang Road, Ferry Connection Road, Nerang-Broadbeach Road, Gooding Drive, Mudgeeraba Road, Worongary-Advancetown-Mudgeeraba Road.

Approximately 160 Police and State Emergency Service personnel are currently involved in the search, including members of Gold Coast Rapid Action Patrol, plain clothes officers and Pol-Air.

Police continue to encourage people in the surrounding areas to remain vigilant.

 

Ring 131 564 to provide any other information

 

Ring 000 to provide life threatening information about this incident.

 

IMPORTANT – Police request this message be broadcast at regular intervals

item.title: LOCATED: UPDATE 1: Amber alert, Missing child, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: THIS CHILD HAS NOW BEEN LOCATED The Queensland Police Service are still seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang at 4.30pm. Approximately 120 Police and State Emergency Service personnel… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
THIS CHILD HAS NOW BEEN LOCATED

The Queensland Police Service are still seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who was reported missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang at 4.30pm.

Approximately 120 Police and State Emergency Service personnel are involved in the search including members of Gold Coast Rapid Action Patrol (RAP), plain clothes officers and Pol-Air.

The primary search area is the western side of the M1 at Nerang but Police encourage people in the surrounding areas to remain vigilant.

Ring 131 564 to provide any other information

Ring 000 to provide life threatening information about this incident.

IMPORTANT – Police request this message be broadcast at regular intervals

BROADCAST SUMMARY

#AmberAlert #Nerang 5y/old girl missing from Nielsens Rd, Nerang. Call 000 or 131 564

item.title: LOCATED: Amber alert, Nerang
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: THIS CHILD HAS NOW BEEN LOCATED The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who went missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang approximately 5 hours ago who may be at significant risk. The girl… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
THIS CHILD HAS NOW BEEN LOCATED

The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 5-year-old girl who went missing from Nielsens Road, Nerang approximately 5 hours ago who may be at significant risk.

The girl is described as Caucasian in appearance with blonde shoulder length hair, blue eyes and is 115cm tall.

She was last seen wearing a dark pink t-shirt with a lady bird emblem on the front, dark blue denim shorts and no foot wear.

Ring 131 564 to provide information about this incident.

Please ring 000 for life threatening information about this incident

IMPORTANT – Police request this message be broadcast at regular intervals

item.title: FINAL ALERT, Rosewood
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service have located 18-month-old girl who was abducted from Rosewood a short time ago in New South Wales. Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance. If you have any further information… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service have located 18-month-old girl who was abducted from Rosewood a short time ago in New South Wales.

Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance.

If you have any further information in relation to this please call 131 564.

item.title: Child abduction charge, Mudgeereba
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: Police have charged a 43-year-old man after an alleged child abduction in Mudgeeraba. It will be alleged that around 4pm yesterday a man removed a child from a residence on Julie Way Mudgeeraba. Police issued an Amber Alert as a… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
Police have charged a 43-year-old man after an alleged child abduction in Mudgeeraba.

It will be alleged that around 4pm yesterday a man removed a child from a residence on Julie Way Mudgeeraba.

Police issued an Amber Alert as a result and the boy was located safe and well in Coolangatta around 9am.

The man has been charged with one count each of abduction of a child under 16 and driver failed to ensure child was in a child restraint. He is due to appear in the Southport Magistrates court tomorrow.

Anyone with information which could assist with this matter should contact Crime Stoppers anonymously via 1800 333 000 or crimestoppers.com.au 24hrs a day.

Crime Stoppers is a registered charity and community volunteer organisation working in partnership with the Queensland Police Service.

For all non-urgent police reporting or general police inquiries contact Policelink on 131 444 or Policelink.qld.gov.au 24hrs a day.

item.title: UPDATE: Missing boy located, Mudgeeraba
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service has located a two-year-old boy who was reported missing from Mudgeeraba yesterday afternoon. The boy was located at Coolangatta just after 9am after police received a call from a member of the public who sighted the… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service has located a two-year-old boy who was reported missing from Mudgeeraba yesterday afternoon.

The boy was located at Coolangatta just after 9am after police received a call from a member of the public who sighted the vehicle which had been the subject of a public appeal.

The two-year-old has since been confirmed as safe and well.

A 43-year-old man is currently assisting police with their investigations into the incident.

Police would like to thank members of the public and the media for their highly valuable assistance with this matter and their ongoing support with Amber Alerts.

item.title: ***LOCATED*** Amber Alert: Boy missing, Mudgeeraba
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: NOTE: THE BOYS HAS BEEN LOCATED SAFE AND WELL Police are seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a two-year-old boy who is missing on the Gold Coast and may be at significant risk. The boy (pictured) was driven from a… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
NOTE: THE BOYS HAS BEEN LOCATED SAFE AND WELL

Police are seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a two-year-old boy who is missing on the Gold Coast and may be at significant risk.

The boy (pictured) was driven from a residence on Julie Way in Mudgeeraba around 4pm yesterday by a man who is known to the boy.

The boy is described as being Caucasian in appearance, having auburn hair and green eyes.

The man has not contacted family or friends since leaving the residence and police hold serious concerns for the child’s safety as the man is believed to have a medical condition.

C

item.title: FINAL ALERT – AMBER ALERT – FOREST LAKE
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: A 4-year-old boy subject to an Amber Alert by the Queensland Police Service was located safe and well a short time ago at an Underwood shopping centre. There is no further information available at this stage… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
A 4-year-old boy subject to an Amber Alert by the Queensland Police Service was located safe and well a short time ago at an Underwood shopping centre.

There is no further information available at this stage.

item.title: CANCELLED AMBER ALERT ISSUED FOR BOY TAKEN FROM FOREST LAKE
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: EDITED – the boy was located safe and well around 4.45pm today, Sunday May 8. The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 4-year-old boy who was taken from Forest Lake an hour and a… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
EDITED – the boy was located safe and well around 4.45pm today, Sunday May 8.

The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 4-year-old boy who was taken from Forest Lake an hour and a half ago who may be at significant risk.

A 33-year-old man who is known to the boy, was seen taking him and putting him into a car.

The boy is described as Caucasian in appearance with dark hair and was wearing black shorts and no shirt.

The man is described as Caucasian in appearance, around 170cm tall with dark brown hair and brown eyes.

The car is described as being a silver 2004 Ford Falcon

Its exact whereabouts is unknown, but may be in the Rochedale or general area.

Ring 131 564 to provide information about this abduction/incident.

Please ring 000 for life threatening information about this abduction/incident

IMPORTANT – Police request this message be broadcast every 15 minutes.

item.title: UPDATE – FINAL – AMBER alert, Edmonton
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service have located the four boys who were at risk after being reported missing from Edmonton. The boys were reported to be with a woman known to them. The woman and the four boys have been located… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service have located the four boys who were at risk after being reported missing from Edmonton.

The boys were reported to be with a woman known to them.

The woman and the four boys have been located safe and well at an Edmonton address around 3:45pm.

The car had been located a short time earlier in Hartley St, Cairns.

Investigations are continuing.

Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance.

If you have any further information please ring 131 564.

item.title: Missing children, Edmonton – LOCATED
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: UPDATE – all have been located safe and well. The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate four boys who may be at significant risk after being reported missing from Edmonton. The boys were last seen… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
UPDATE – all have been located safe and well.

The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate four boys who may be at significant risk after being reported missing from Edmonton.

The boys were last seen with a woman (picture removed), who is known to them this morning.

The boys are aged nine, eight, four and eight months old.

It is believed the woman and children may be travelling south to Ingham or Townsville in a vehicle.

Police hold serious concerns for the welfare of the children and are urging anyone with information to contact the Amber Alert hotline on 131 564.

(images removed)

item.title: FINAL AMBER ALERT Southport
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service have located the 7-year-old boy who was reported missing from Southport around 20 minutes ago safe and well. Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance. The scheduled 9am media conference… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service have located the 7-year-old boy who was reported missing from Southport around 20 minutes ago safe and well.

Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance.

The scheduled 9am media conference will go ahead as advised.

If you have any further information please ring 131 564.

item.title: Amber alert: Twin Waters
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: Update: This boy has been located safe and well.  The Queensland Police Service are seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 13-year-old boy, reported missing from Twin Waters this afternoon. The boy (picture removed) was last seen riding his bicycle… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
Update: This boy has been located safe and well. 

The Queensland Police Service are seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a 13-year-old boy, reported missing from Twin Waters this afternoon.

The boy (picture removed) was last seen riding his bicycle at around 4pm this afternoon and has not contacted family or friends since. Police hold concerns for his welfare as it is out of character for him to not return.

He is described as Caucasian in appearance,  approximately 168cm tall with curly, dark-coloured hair. He was last seen wearing a black shirt, black bicycle helmet, striped shorts and bright blue Nike shoes. He was last seen riding a black mountain bike with a green strip on the cross bar.

Ring 131 564 to provide information about this incident.

Please ring 000 for life threatening information about this incident  

IMPORTANT – Police request this message be broadcast every 15 minutes.

item.title: FINAL ALERT – Child Abduction Alert, Edmonton
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service have recently located the 2-year-old boy who was abducted from Edmonton around 2:05pm yesterday in Cairns. Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance. Anyone with information which could assist… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service have recently located the 2-year-old boy who was abducted from Edmonton around 2:05pm yesterday in Cairns.

Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance.

 

Anyone with information which could assist with this matter should contact Crime Stoppers anonymously via 1800 333 000 or crimestoppers.com.au 24hrs a day.

Crime Stoppers is a registered charity and community volunteer organisation working in partnership with the Queensland Police Service.

For all non-urgent police reporting or general police inquiries contact Policelink on 131 444 or Policelink.qld.gov.au 24hrs a day.

item.title: UPDATE: Child Abduction Alert, South Mackay
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service is still seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a five-year-old girl who may be at risk after being taken from an address in South Mackay overnight. She was taken sometime around 12.30am from a Tay… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service is still seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a five-year-old girl who may be at risk after being taken from an address in South Mackay overnight.

She was taken sometime around 12.30am from a Tay Street residence.

She is believed to be with a man and a teenage girl and possibly travelling in a white 1997 Mitsubishi Magna (similar to the vehicle pictured).

She is described as Caucasian with short blonde hair and a fair complexion.

Ring 131 564 to provide information about this abduction/incident.

Please ring Triple Zero (000) for life threatening information about this incident.

item.title: Child stealing charge, Hope Island
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: Police have charged a man after an alleged child abduction at Hope Island yesterday afternoon. It will be alleged that around 3.20pm a man entered a Halycon Way business and removed a three-year-old boy, known to the man, from the… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
Police have charged a man after an alleged child abduction at Hope Island yesterday afternoon.

It will be alleged that around 3.20pm a man entered a Halycon Way business and removed a three-year-old boy, known to the man, from the premises.

Police issued a child abduction alert last night and the boy was located safe and well in Coolangatta around 9pm.

A 33-year-old Coombabah man has been charged with one count each of child stealing, enter premises and commit indictable offence and contravention of a domestic violence order. He is due to appear in the Southport Magistrates Court today.

Anyone with information which could assist with this matter should contact Crime Stoppers anonymously via 1800 333 000 or crimestoppers.com.au 24hrs a day.

Crime Stoppers is a registered charity and community volunteer organisation working in partnership with the Queensland Police Service.

For all non-urgent police reporting or general police inquiries contact Policelink on 131 444 or Policelink.qld.gov.au 24hrs a day.

item.title: Final – Child abduction – Hope Island
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service have located the three-year-old boy who was abducted from Halycon Way, Hope Island about six hours ago. Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance. If you have any further information… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service have located the three-year-old boy who was abducted from Halycon Way, Hope Island about six hours ago.

Police would like to thank the media and the public for their assistance.

If you have any further information please ring 131 564.

item.title: FINALISED- Child Abduction Alert – Hope Island
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a three-year-old boy who was taken from Halcyon Way, Hope Island about 5 hours ago and who may be at risk. A man was seen taking the boy… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
The Queensland Police Service is seeking urgent public assistance to help locate a three-year-old boy who was taken from Halcyon Way, Hope Island about 5 hours ago and who may be at risk.

A man was seen taking the boy and putting them into a car.

The boy (pictured) is described as having shoulder-length blonde hair, with a fair complexion and was wearing a grey hoodie with blue jeans.

The car (similar pictured) is described as being a white, Dodge Journey, bearing the registration number 115-VKY or 014-TDB.

Ring 131 564 to provide information about this abduction.

Please ring 000 for life threatening information about this abduction/incident

IMPORTANT – Police request this message be broadcast every 15 minutes

item.title: Boy located, Woollongabba
item.dc:creator: QPS Media
item.description: Police are appealing for public assistance to locate the parents of a boy found at Gabba Central Shopping Centre. The boy was located at about 2:30pm today in the carpark of the centre by member of the public. The boy… Read Post
item.content:encoded:
Police are appealing for public assistance to locate the parents of a boy found at Gabba Central Shopping Centre.

The boy was located at about 2:30pm today in the carpark of the centre by member of the public.

The boy is approximately three years old and is described as caucasian, blonde wavy hair, blue eyes, wearing a blue t shirt and blue shorts with orange fish on them.

The boy is safe however police are appealing for anyone who recognises this clothing to contact Policelink.

Anyone with information which could assist with this matter should contact Crime Stoppers anonymously via 1800 333 000 or crimestoppers.com.au 24hrs a day.

Crime Stoppers is a registered charity and community volunteer organisation working in partnership with the Queensland Police Service.

For all non-urgent police reporting or general police inquiries contact Policelink on 131 444 or Policelink.qld.gov.au 24hrs a day.
